page.title: 07STOKE HOUSE
page.content: Stoke House is a 200 year old building.Before it became an observation and assessment centre a man called Harvey who was a leather merchant and then a solicitor by the name of John Brown Twist (1809-1885) owned the house.He was an important man and was the director of the Gas Company and Coventry Canal and he was a respected churchman. The old house had a stable and a cobbled courtyard and is original apart from the fire doors.In 1939-1945 it was used as a balloon barrage unit. After the war it became a children's home but in 1977 Patrick Jenkin opened a new block for children who are disruptive or have problems.Now there are five teachers and 30 carestaff.The age range of the children is from about 11 to 19.
